articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry
articles.description: With an economy in ruins and a crumbling state, Lebanon can ill afford another war between Hezbollah and Israel.
articles.title: Broken Lebanon cannot afford war between Hezbollah and Israel

articles.author: Reuters Fact Check
articles.description: Footage of U.S. Navy aircraft carriers dating back 10 years has been miscaptioned online as showing Turkish warships moving toward Gaza amid the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict in October.
articles.title: Fact Check: Decade-old US Navy videos shared as Turkish warship nearing Gaza

articles.author: Gabrielle Tétrault-Farber
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden has cast doubt on casualty figures provided by Palestinian officials in Gaza, but international humanitarian agencies consider them broadly accurate and historically reliable.
articles.title: Despite Biden's doubts, humanitarian agencies consider Gaza toll reliable

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis presided on Friday at a special prayer service for peace in the Middle East and other areas of conflict.
articles.title: As Gaza war rages, Pope Francis leads day of prayer for world peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military accused the Islamist movement Hamas on Friday of using the main hospital in Gaza as a shield for its tunnels and operational centres.
articles.title: Israeli military says Hamas hiding tunnels, operations centres in Gaza hospital

articles.author: Michael Holden
articles.description: Antisemitic and Islamaphobic incidents have almost doubled in just over a week in London, police data showed on Friday, in the wake of the attack by Hamas militants on southern Israel nearly three weeks ago and subsequent bombardment by Israel of Gaza.
articles.title: London hate crimes rise again in wake of Middle East conflict

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Qatar told the U.S. it was open to reconsidering the presence of Hamas in Qatar once a crisis is resolved to secure the release of scores of hostages taken to Gaza by the Palestinian militant group, a senior U.S. official said on Friday.
articles.title: Qatar open to reconsidering Hamas presence in Qatar, US official says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli air and ground forces are stepping up operations in the Gaza Strip, Israel's chief military spokesperson said on Friday, amid reports of heavy bombing of the besieged enclave.
articles.title: Israel stepping up ground operations in Gaza Strip

articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.description: "Trump Too Small" - a phrase mocking former President Donald Trump that a California lawyer intended to slap on T-shirts - instead has become the center of another U.S. Supreme Court battle exploring the intersection of trademark law and free speech rights.
articles.title: 'Trump Too Small' T-shirt slogan turns into US Supreme Court battle

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada will step up the verification of university acceptance letters as it seeks to prevent immigration by fraudsters who target international students, Immigration Minister Marc Miller said on Friday.
articles.title: Canada to ramp up verification of student admissions to curb immigration fraud
